page.title: 19Sunderland Point/People
page.content: In recent years, the number of people living at Sunderland Point and making their living there has dwindled. Farming, fishing, and piloting occupies just three families and of the other households about half comprise retired or unemployed people, and the other half send one or more adult members to work outside the village as teachers, dock workers, workers at the Heysham nuclear power stations, nurses. The village has a high proportion of young children but no school. About half the households have family links with the village for several generations. Sunderland Point draws visitors because of its unusual and attractive setting on one of the few short stretches of unspoilt coast in Lancashire; its history and birdlife.
